00010 #ifndef __JAMOMA_CLOCK_H__

00017 
00018 // On the Mac we use CoreAudio to get audio-priority callbacks, what should we do on Windows?
00019 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00020 #include <CoreAudio/AudioHardware.h>
00021 #endif
00022 
00023 typedef struct _jamoma_clock{
00024         t_pxobject                      obj;
00025         unsigned long           sr;
00026         double                          one_over_sr;
00027         unsigned long           samples_per_block;
00028         double                          current_time;                   // in ticks
00029         unsigned long long      current_samples;        
00030         // TODO: some sort of accessor that would set tick period by saying 1000 ticks per second or something
00031         
00032         // CoreAudio-specific members
00033         #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00034         Boolean                         initialized;                    // successful init?
00035         Boolean                         soundPlaying;                   // playing now?
00036         AudioDeviceID           device;                                 // the default device
00037         UInt32                          deviceBufferSize;               // bufferSize returned by kAudioDevicePropertyBufferSize
00038         AudioStreamBasicDescription     deviceFormat;   // info about the default device
00039         #endif // MAC_VERSION
00040 } t_jamoma_clock;

00052                                                                                 const AudioTimeStamp*   inNow,

00055                                                                                 AudioBufferList*                outOutputData, 
00056                                                                                 const AudioTimeStamp*   inOutputTime, 
00057                                                                                 void*                                   baton);
00058 #endif // MAC_VERSION
